source_sentence: 沙彌羅經
translation: *Sāmamīra-sūtra

source_sentence: 失譯附三秦錄
translation: Lost translation appended to the Tripiṭaka of the Three Qin

source_sentence: 昔有小兒，名曰沙彌羅。
translation: In the old days there was a small boy named Sāmamīra.

source_sentence: 年始七歲，意好道德，隨一沙門，為作弟子。
translation: When he was seven years old, his mind was fond of morality and he became a disciple of one of the śramaṇas.

source_sentence: 處在山中，給師所使；
translation: He stayed in the mountains and gave them to his teachers as messengers.

source_sentence: 誦念經法，心不懈怠。
translation: They recite the teachings of the scriptures without laziness in their minds.

source_sentence: 至年八歲，得阿羅漢。
translation: At the age of eight he attained arhatship.

source_sentence: 道眼能洞視，所見無極；
translation: The eye of enlightenment can see in all directions, and what it sees is infinite.

source_sentence: 耳能徹聽，天上、天下所為善惡，皆悉聞之；
translation: Their ears can hear all the good and bad deeds of heaven and earth.

source_sentence: 身能飛行，在能至到。
translation: The body can fly, but it depends on the ability to reach.

source_sentence: 能分一身，變作萬身；
translation: They can divide a body into one body and transform it into myriad bodies.

source_sentence: 自在現化，無所不作。
translation: They are free to manifest and transform themselves, doing nothing they won’t do.

source_sentence: 自知宿命，所從來生，及諸人物、蚑行蠕動皆悉知之。
translation: Knowing for themselves their past lives, where they came from and where they were born, as well as the movements of other people and creatures, they all know them.

source_sentence: 坐見宿命，為五母作子，時便自笑。
translation: Seeing his past lives, he sat and made a child for the five mothers, then smiled to himself.

source_sentence: 時師顧問，語沙彌羅：「汝笑何等？
translation: The teacher's advisor then said to Sāmamīra, What are you smiling at?

source_sentence: 此間山中亦無歌舞，汝笑我耶？」
translation: There's no singing or dancing in this mountain, are you laughing at me?

source_sentence: 沙彌羅言：「不敢笑師，我還自笑！
translation: Śrāmaṇerāla said, I dare not laugh, teacher; I will laugh back!

source_sentence: 一神受身，為五母作子，五母為我晝夜啼哭，感傷愁毒，不能自止，恒言念子，
translation: The five mothers cried for me day and night, grieved and distressed, unable to control themselves. They constantly said, “O son!

source_sentence: 未曾忽忘。
translation: I've never forgotten it.

source_sentence: 自念一身，而愁五家，是以自笑，不敢笑師。
translation: Because he thought of his own body and grieved for the five families, he smiled to himself and didn't dare laugh at the teacher.

source_sentence: 「我為第一母作子時，有並隣居，亦生一子，與我同日。
translation: “When my first mother gave birth to a child, there was someone living together with me and they also gave birth to a child on the same day as mine.

source_sentence: 我死以後，同日子出入行步。
translation: On the same day after my death, I'll go in and out on the same day.

source_sentence: 母見之，便言：『悲念我子在家，亦當出入行步如是！』
translation: Seeing him, the mother said, 'I'm sad to think that my child is at home, and so will he go out and enter likewise!'

source_sentence: 感傷悲哀，淚下如雨。
translation: They were grieved and saddened, shedding tears like rain.

source_sentence: 「我為第二母作子時，我夭命早死。
translation: “When I became a child to my second mother, I died young.

source_sentence: 我母見人乳兒，便念乳我，悲念感傷。
translation: Seeing someone nursing a child, my mother thinks of the milk as self and is overcome with sorrow.

source_sentence: 「我為第三母作子時，年始十歲，我命復死。
translation: “When I became my third mother’s child, when I was only ten years old, my life died again.

source_sentence: 我母飯時，便悲淚出：『我子在者，當與俱食；
translation: At the time of my mother’s meal, she wept in distress and said, “If my child is with me, I will give him food to you.

source_sentence: 捨我死去，使我獨食？』
translation: Will you abandon me and die, leaving me to eat alone?'

source_sentence: 哽咽呼天，怨言念子。
translation: They s sobbed and called out to the gods, resenting their words and thoughts of enmity.

source_sentence: 「我為第四母作子時，薄命先死。
translation: “When I became a child to the fourth mother, I died before my life.

source_sentence: 我母見我等輩，同時因媒娶婦，悲念我言：『今子在者，亦當娶婦！
translation: Seeing that we were all in the same group, my mother married our wives at the same time because of a match, and she grieved for us, saying, 'Now that you're here, you must also marry your wife!'

source_sentence: 我何所犯，而殺我子？』
translation: What's wrong with me killing my child?'

source_sentence: 「我為第五母作子時，年始七歲，好道辭家；
translation: “When my fifth mother was seven years old, I renounced the householder’s life at the age of seven.

source_sentence: 捨母隨師，入山求道；
translation: They abandoned their mother and went with their teacher into the mountains to seek enlightenment.

source_sentence: 一心思禪，得阿羅漢道。
translation: With a single thought of meditation, he attained the path of the arhat.

source_sentence: 我母日日啼哭、念我：『我生一子，隨師學道，不知所在？
translation: Day after day, my mother cried in tears and thought to herself, “I gave birth to a child who followed his teacher and studied the path but did not know where he was.

source_sentence: 飢渴寒暑，今為死、生？』
translation: Hungry, thirsty, cold, and hot, is it death or birth now?'

source_sentence: 「於是五母共會一處，各各悲哀，言念我子，相對啼哭，不能自止。
translation: “Thereupon, the five mothers assembled in one place. Each of them grieved and said, ‘This is my child.’ They wept and cried to each other but they could not stop themselves.

source_sentence: 我一魂神，展轉五母腹中作子，依因二親，受形成人，而使五母啼哭發狂，
translation: I, a goddess, am born as a child in the womb of five mothers. By relying on my two relatives to give birth to me, I cause these five mothers to weep and go mad.

source_sentence: 各念我身，乃欲自殺，是故笑耳！
translation: Each thought of my body and wanted to kill himself, so he laughed!

source_sentence: 「我念世間，欲網因緣、生死罪福，造行根源——惡入地獄，善行生天。
translation: I'm mindful of the world, the causes and conditions of the web of desire, the sins and merits of birth-and-death, the root cause of creating actions - badly entering hell and being born in heaven with good actions.

source_sentence: 我畏世苦，辭家入山；
translation: Fearing worldly suffering, I left home and went into the mountains.

source_sentence: 精進禪定，得道昇仙。
translation: He exerted himself in meditation and attained the Way to become a sage.

source_sentence: 覩見餓鬼、地獄、畜生苦痛之處，代為恐怖，憐傷五母，不能自脫，又憂我身。
translation: Seeing the places where hungry ghosts, hells, and animals suffer pain, they become frightened on their behalf, pitying their five mothers so that they can't get rid of themselves and grieving for themselves.

source_sentence: 我所求索，願行如言，永離生死，斷絕身根，如人不種，當所泥洹。」
translation: Whatever I ask for, I wish to do as I say, be permanently free of birth and death, cut off the body faculty, and become like a person who doesn't plant it, which will lead to nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 善會師說已，飛騰虛空。
translation: After the good assembly master had explained it, he flew up into the sky.

source_sentence: 沙彌羅經
translation: *Sāmamīra-sūtra
